contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Malbork County | native_name = Powiat malborski | settlement_type = [[Powiat|County]] | total_type = Total | image_flag = POL powiat malborski flag.svg | image_shield = POL powiat malborski COA.svg |image_map=POL powiat malborski locator map (label-pl).svg |map_caption=Division into gminas | coordinates_display = inline,title | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Pomeranian Voivodeship|Pomeranian]] | area_total_km2 = 494.63 | population_total = 62960| population_as_of = 2006 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_urban = 42925 | population_blank1_title = Rural | population_blank1 = 20035 | coor_pinpoint = Malbork | latd = 54 | latm = 2 | lats = | latNS = N | longd = 19 | longm = 2 | longs = | longEW = E | seat = [[Malbork]] | parts_type = [[Gmina]]s | parts = Total 6 (incl. 1 urban) | p1 = [[Malbork]] | p2 = [[Gmina Lichnowy]] | p3 = [[Gmina Malbork]] | p4 = [[Gmina Miłoradz]] | p5 = [[Gmina Nowy Staw]] | p6 = [[Gmina Stare Pole]] | blank_name = [[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] | blank_info = GMB | website = http://www.powiat.malbork.pl }} __NOTOC__ '''Malbork County''' ({{lang-pl|powiat malborski}}) is a unit of territorial administration and local government ([[powiat]]) in [[Pomeranian Voivodeship]], northern [[Poland]]. It came into being on January 1, 1999, as a result of the [[Polish local government reforms]] passed in 1998. Its administrative seat and largest town is [[Malbork]] (site of the historic [[Malbork Castle]]), {{convert|46|km|mi|0}} south-east of the regional capital [[Gdańsk]]. The only other town in the county is [[Nowy Staw]], lying {{convert|12|km|mi|0|abbr=on}} north of Malbork. Until 2002 the county also included the areas which now make up [[Sztum County]]. The county covers an area of {{convert|494.63|km2|sqmi|1}}. As of 2006 its total population is 62,960, out of which the population of Malbork is 38,478, that of Nowy Staw is 4,447, and the rural population is 20,035. {{Pomeranian Voivodeship Labelled Map Small}} <br> {{clearleft}} ''Malbork County on a map of the counties of Pomeranian Voivodeship'' Malbork County is bordered by [[Nowy Dwór Gdański County]] to the north, [[Elbląg County]] to the east, [[Sztum County]] to the south, [[Tczew County]] to the west and [[Gdańsk County]] to the north-west. ==Administrative division== The county is subdivided into six [[gmina]]s (one urban, one urban-rural and four rural): {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Gmina ! scope="col" | Type ! scope="col" | Area (km²) ! scope="col" | Population (2006) ! scope="col" | Seat |- ! scope="row" | [[Malbork]] | urban | style="text-align: right;" | 17.2 | style="text-align: right;" | 38,478 | |- ! scope="row" | [[Gmina Nowy Staw]] | urban-rural | style="text-align: right;" | 114.4 | style="text-align: right;" | 7,840 | [[Nowy Staw]] |- ! scope="row" | [[Gmina Stare Pole]] | rural | style="text-align: right;" | 79.7 | style="text-align: right;" | 4,595 | [[Stare Pole]] |- ! scope="row" | [[Gmina Lichnowy]] | rural | style="text-align: right;" | 88.7 | style="text-align: right;" | 4,577 | [[Lichnowy, Malbork County|Lichnowy]] |- ! scope="row" | [[Gmina Malbork]] | rural | style="text-align: right;" | 100.9 | style="text-align: right;" | 4,043 | [[Malbork]] * |- ! scope="row" | [[Gmina Miłoradz]] | rural | style="text-align: right;" | 93.8 | style="text-align: right;" | 3,427 | [[Miłoradz]] |- class="sortbottom" | scope="row" colspan="5" | * seat not part of the gmina |} ==References== *[http://www.stat.gov.pl/gus/45_655_PLK_HTML.htm Polish official population figures 2006] <br> {{Malbork County}} {{Pomeranian Voivodeship}} [[Category:Malbork County| ]] [[Category:Land counties of Pomeranian Voivodeship|Malbork]]
